results:
Based on the search results, I found rich information about Napoleon's meeting with Goethe in Erfurt in 1808, including details about their discussion of Werther. Here's what I learned:

## Napoleon's Meeting with Goethe at Erfurt (October 2, 1808)

Napoleon's famous greeting of the author Werther on 2 October, «Voilà un homme!» ('Now here is a real man!'), is not mentioned by the French diplomat.(no content)Napoleon met Goethe on October 2, 1808 in the Governor's Palace at Erfurt.

### Napoleon's Admiration for Werther

The emperor had however read the novel and Goethe was very proud of it: «Take your hat off to me and bow down; do you know which book Bonaparte took with him in his luggage to Egypt? My Werther!» (Conversations with Eckermann, 7 April, 1829).

More specifically, Napoleon claimed to have read Goethe's blazing bestseller, Die Leiden des jungen Werthers ("The Sorrows of Young Werther") no fewer than seven times, and even taken it with him on campaign, thus confirming the search query's reference to "7 times."

### The Conversation About Werther

During their meeting, He then brought the conversation to Werther, which he must have studied in detail.(no content)He then brought the conversation to Werther, which he must have studied in detail. The discussion became more intimate at this point, as He turned his back to those people and spoke to me lowering his voice.

### Context of the Meeting

The meeting took place during the Congress of Erfurt, where The Congress of Erfurt was the meeting between Napoleon, Emperor of the French, and Alexander I, Emperor of All Russia, from Tuesday 27 September to Friday 14 October 1808 intended to reaffirm the alliance concluded the previous year with the Treaties of Tilsit.

Napoleon wanted to co-opt the German cultural elite and enhance his reputation as a friend of the arts and literature. To this end, the great Goethe was invited to an interview.

### Additional Details

The young conqueror read Goethe's The Sorrows of Young Werther multiple times, and carried it in his campaign library. This meeting was significant for both men - The meeting in 1808 left a deep impression on Goethe.(no content)I received the Cross of the Légion d'Honneur.

The search results confirm all the key elements mentioned in your query: Napoleon's Egypt campaign (where he took Werther), his reading Werther 7 times, the Erfurt meeting in 1808, and his encounter with Goethe.
